data.title: The Collected Stories of Arthur C. Clarke
data.meta_description: Find out how long it will take you to read 'The Collected Stories of Arthur C. Clarke' by using our book word count search. Search for a book, tell us how fast you read, and start reading!
data.text:
The average reader will spend 16 hours and 16 minutes reading this book at 250 WPM (words per minute).

How long will it take you?

Your speed

To find your reading speed you can take one of our WPM tests.

Author of 2001: A Space Odyssey, Childhood's End, The City and the Stars, and the Hugo and Nebula Award-winning Rendezvous with Rama, Arthur C. Clarke is the most celebrated science fiction author alive. He isâwith H. G. Wells, Isaac Asimov, and Robert A. Heinleinâone of the writers who define science fiction in our time. Now Clarke has cooperated in the preparation of a massive, definitive edition of his collected shorter works. From early work like "Rescue Party" and "The Lion of Comarre," through classics like "The Star," "Earthlight," "The Nine Billion Names of God," and "The Sentinel" (kernel of the later novel, and movie, 2001: A Space Odyssey), all the way to later work like "A Meeting with Medusa" and "The Hammer of God," this immense volume encapsulates one of the great SF careers of all time.
